com.syncron.ps.tools.fileMonitoring

Class FileMonStarter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.syncron.ps.tools.fileMonitoring.FileMonStarter

  • public class FileMonStarter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class initializes the logger, sender and monitored directories based on the property file passed as an argument to the method main. If not provided, DEFAULT_PROPERTY_FILE_PATH is used.
    Author:
    micsie

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This static method creates a new object of the class and executes start method with a property file path based on the application arguments. If no argument passed, DEFAULT_PROPERTY_FILE_PATH used as default.
        Parameters:
        args - The applications arguments.

      • start

        public void start(java.lang.String propertyFilePath)
        This method reads the property file located at propertyFilePath. Based on the properties, it initializes logs, sender and monitored directories. Finally the file monitor is created and the processing of events is initiated.
        Parameters:
        propertyFilePath - A path to the properties file.

      • getSFTPFileSender

        private SFTPFileSender getSFTPFileSender(org.dom4j.Document document)
                                  throws ConnectionDetailsException
        Gets an SFTP file sender based on properties in a document. If property "port" not provided, by default the port number is set to 22.
        Parameters:
        document - An XML document describing connection details
        Returns:
        SFTP file sender.
        Throws:
        ConnectionDetailsException

      • initMonitoredDirectories

        private void initMonitoredDirectories(org.dom4j.Document document)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes monitored directories based on properties in a document.
        Parameters:
        document - An XML document containing monitored directories.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • registerDirectory

        private void registerDirectory(java.nio.file.Path path,
                     java.lang.String remoteDirectory,
                     java.util.List<org.dom4j.Node> maskNodes,
                     boolean recursive)
        This method registers a monitored directory based on the directory path, remote directory path string, and list of masks. If recursive is true, then all local sub-directories are registered with corresponding sub-directories on the remote side. E.g., if /path that maps to /remote is registered and it contains /path/sub folder, then /path/sub is registered and maps to /remote/sub directory.
        TODO: inferring remote sub-directories are implemented by appending string literals / and sub-folders names. It probably should be changed.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the registered directory.
        remoteDirectory - The corresponding remote directory.
        maskNodes - XML nodes describing filter masks.
        recursive - If true, sub-folders will be registered as well.

      • initializeLog

        private void initializeLog(org.dom4j.Document document)
        Initialize the logger configuration.
        Parameters:
        document - The XML document containing the path to the log4j configuration file.
